alert.note: Alert for Cass; Harrison; Marion; Panola; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 9:02PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern De Soto and southwestern Caddo Parishes, Marion, southeastern Cass, Harrison, eastern Panola and north central Shelby Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 901 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waskom, or 12 miles east of Marshall, moving northwest at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marshall, Mansfield, Vivian, Greenwood, Waskom, Jefferson, Stonewall, Logansport, Oil City, Joaquin, Deberry, Elysian Fields, Lodi, Smithland, Berea, Karnack, Woodlawn, Gray, Scottsville and South Mansfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
